page.title: 02 Farming in Tamworth (Two).
page.content: The {wheat} seed is crushed to make flour. From the flour you can make bread and cakes. To make bread the flour is made into dough and left to rise before it is cooked. Then the bread is sent by lorry to shops where people buy it to make toast and sandwiches. Farmers keep {cows} because we can get milk from them and from milk we can make butter, cream and cheese. {Sheep} and cows are used for meat. They are taken to the slaughterhouse in a big lorry where they are killed and the flesh is cut up to be sold for meat.
